intro: Echites echites, commonly known as the spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its long, arching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense clumps. Echites echites is native to southern Africa and is often cultivated as a decorative and easy-to-care-for plant.
